page.title: 03Few buses but many Cars.
page.content: Our area has a fine history of transport crossed as it is by the {Chelmer - Blackwater Canal}.Also the former {Railway Line}from Maldon to Witham passes by Langford.Today,one main road passes through our area at Langford.The valley is patterned with roads which serve the little Hamlets like Curling Tye Green,and farms.The road from Ulting to Woodham Walter makes the first upstream crossing of the river Chelmer-It's often flooded.Most of the families in our area own a car (Only 14% in Ulting and 13% in Langford of Families {don't}own cars).School Buses pick up children to take them to school in Maldon & Witham.Other services are not good. Nine buses go through Langford but none on Sundays and{no}"Commuter Buses" serve Woodham Walter.
